intro: Dennettia, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, clustered inflorescences. Dennettia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and blooms. They thrive in humid, shaded environments and are popular in horticulture.
